headline: Strategist sees Deere, Caterpillar as low-volatility AI plays
summary: STORY: "There's $640 billion in announced capex spending to grow AI compute," Mulberry explained. "That's data centers. So we can follow that money into balance sheets like John Deere, Caterpillar, even Lockheed Martin," companies that are "needed to move dirt to actually construct these very large buildings.""It's being dubbed the HALO trade," he added. "Hard Asset with Low chance of Obsolescence. These companies are going to be around for a long time with the amount of demand built up for AI computing power."

headline: AVLV Is Up 24.5% While Filtering Out the Value Traps Other ETFs Miss
summary: Most value ETFs simply screen for cheap stocks. The Avantis U.S. Large Cap Value ETF takes a different approach: it filters for stocks that are both cheap and profitable, a distinction that historically separates durable value from value traps. That dual screen is the core thesis behind AVLV, and whether it justifies owning it over ... AVLV Is Up 24.5% While Filtering Out the Value Traps Other ETFs Miss

headline: Does Caterpillar’s AI Power Deal And Record Results Redefine The Bull Case For CAT?
summary: Caterpillar recently delivered record quarterly and full-year results, with its Power & Energy unit posting 23% annual growth and securing a large agreement to supply natural gas generators and battery storage for 2 gigawatts of capacity at American Intelligence and Power’s Monarch Compute Campus by 2027. This surge in power-generation demand, including interest from hedge funds and customers beyond traditional data centers, has reinforced Caterpillar’s position in the fast-growing AI and...

headline: Caterpillar vs Deere: Heavy Machinery Legends Post Opposite Earnings Stories and the Gap Is Widening Fast
summary: Caterpillar (NYSE: CAT) and Deere (NYSE: DE) both reported recent quarters that tell strikingly different stories. Caterpillar posted a record quarter on surging data center power demand. Deere beat a depressed earnings bar and raised guidance, positioning itself as a cycle-bottom recovery play in agriculture and construction. Record Revenue for One, Recovery Signals for the ... Caterpillar vs Deere: Heavy Machinery Legends Post Opposite Earnings Stories and the Gap Is Widening Fast

headline: Caterpillar Stock Is Rolling. It Just Got Another Price Target Hike.
summary: The incredible momentum in  Caterpillar  stock looks set to continue with a new analyst price target that is the second-highest on Wall Street.  Shares of the heavy machinery maker were up 0.7% at $773.93 in premarket trading Wednesday, while S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average futures were both up about 0.3%.  The move came after Wells Fargo analyst Jerry Revich increased his price target to $870 a share from $756.

headline: Is Caterpillar Stock Outperforming the S&P 500?
summary: While Caterpillar has outpaced the S&P 500 Index over the past year, analysts are cautiously optimistic about the stock’s prospects.

headline: Jim Cramer's top 10 things to watch in the stock market Wednesday

headline: CNBC's UK Exchange newsletter: With shares up 1,200%, Rolls-Royce’s CEO has lots to shout about
summary: As with its aircraft engines, there are a lot of moving parts to Rolls-Royce — not least in some of its newest ventures.
